ISSUE.TITLE: "podman images list" doesn't behave as documented
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST? (leave only one on its own line)** /kind bug **Description** The manual page for `podman-images` lists the three forms `podman images`, `podman images list`, and `podman images ls`. Nothing in the text mentions the three forms, so the impression one gets is they are equivalent. However, `podman images` takes any additional non-option argument as an image name. Only images with this tag are listed, and the `list` argument is treated as a tag name. Similarly for `ls`. Nothing in the manual page mentions the option of adding a tag name. **Steps to reproduce the issue:** 1. `podman images list` **Describe the results you received:** A list of all images tagged _list_. (Normally none, except when testing the feature.) **Describe the results you expected:** Based on the manual page I would have expected the same output as from `podman images`. The actual behaviour is probably better though, so I would suggest just updating the manual page. **Additional information you deem important (e.g. issue happens only occasionally):** `podman images --help` gives correct information. **Output of `podman version`:** ``` Client: Podman Engine Version: 4.1.1 API Version: 4.1.1 Go Version: go1.18.4 Built: Fri Jul 22 21:05:59 2022 OS/Arch: linux/amd64 ``` **Output of `podman info`:** ``` host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.26.1 cgroupControllers: - memory - pids cgroupManager: systemd cgroupVersion: v2 conmon: package: conmon-2.0.30-2.fc35.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/conmon version: 'conmon version 2.0.30, commit: ' cpuUtilization: idlePercent: 99.41 systemPercent: 0.22 userPercent: 0.38 cpus: 12 distribution: distribution: fedora version: "36" eventLogger: journald hostname: mimmi idMappings: gidmap: - container_id: 0 host_id: 1003 size: 1 - container_id: 1 host_id: 100000 size: 65536 uidmap: - container_id: 0 host_id: 1003 size: 1 - container_id: 1 host_id: 100000 size: 65536 kernel: 5.18.11-200.fc36.x86_64 linkmode: dynamic logDriver: journald memFree: 549335040 memTotal: 33507659776 networkBackend: netavark ociRuntime: name: crun package: crun-1.4.4-1.fc36.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/crun version: |- crun version 1.4.4 commit: 6521fcc5806f20f6187eb933f9f45130c86da230 spec: 1.0.0 +SYSTEMD +SELINUX +APPARMOR +CAP +SECCOMP +EBPF +CRIU +YAJL os: linux remoteSocket: path: /run/user/1003/podman/podman.sock security: apparmorEnabled: false capabilities: CAP_CHOWN,CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE,CAP_FOWNER,CAP_FSETID,CAP_KILL,CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE,CAP_SETFCAP,CAP_SETGID,CAP_SETPCAP,CAP_SETUID,CAP_SYS_CHROOT rootless: true seccompEnabled: true seccompProfilePath: /usr/share/containers/seccomp.json selinuxEnabled: true serviceIsRemote: false slirp4netns: executable: /usr/bin/slirp4netns package: slirp4netns-1.1.4-4.dev.giteecccdb.fc33.x86_64 version: |- slirp4netns version 1.1.4+dev commit: eecccdb96f587b11d7764556ffacfeaffe4b6e11 libslirp: 4.3.1 SLIRP_CONFIG_VERSION_MAX: 3 libseccomp: 2.5.3 swapFree: 34330984448 swapTotal: 34359730176 uptime: 302h 42m 31.6s (Approximately 12.58 days) plugins: log: - k8s-file - none - passthrough - journald network: - bridge - macvlan volume: - local registries: search: - registry.fedoraproject.org - registry.access.redhat.com - docker.io - quay.io store: configFile: /home/g√∂ran/.config/containers/storage.conf containerStore: number: 1 paused: 0 running: 0 stopped: 1 graphDriverName: overlay graphOptions: overlay.mount_program: Executable: /usr/bin/fuse-overlayfs Package: fuse-overlayfs-1.2.0-1.fc33.x86_64 Version: |- fusermount3 version: 3.9.3 fuse-overlayfs: version 1.1.0 FUSE library version 3.9.3 using FUSE kernel interface version 7.31 graphRoot: /var/tmp/testkatalog/containers/storage graphRootAllocated: 1796514123776 graphRootUsed: 1421136625664 graphStatus: Backing Filesystem: extfs Native Overlay Diff: "false" Supports d_type: "true" Using metacopy: "false" imageCopyTmpDir: /var/tmp imageStore: number: 5 runRoot: /run/user/1003 volumePath: /var/tmp/testkatalog/containers/storage/volumes version: APIVersion: 4.1.1 Built: 1658516759 BuiltTime: Fri Jul 22 21:05:59 2022 GitCommit: "" GoVersion: go1.18.4 Os: linux OsArch: linux/amd64 Version: 4.1.1 ``` **Package info (e.g. output of `rpm -q podman` or `apt list podman`):** ``` podman-4.1.1-3.fc36.x86_64 ``` **Have you tested with the latest version of Podman and have you checked the Podman Troubleshooting Guide? (https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/main/troubleshooting.md)** Sort of, I checked the [source](https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/main/docs/source/markdown/podman-images.1.md) and the problem is still there. **Additional environment details (AWS, VirtualBox, physical, etc.):**

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #15301 from chenxiaolong/restart_never podman-kube@.service.in: Remove Restart=never option with typo

COMMIT.MESSAGE: podman images and friends can take one image as argument Fixes: https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/15309 Signed-off-by: Daniel J Walsh <dwalsh@redhat.com>
podman images and friends can take one image as argument Fixes: https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/15309 Signed-off-by: Daniel J Walsh <dwalsh@redhat.com>
